config.question: The United States gave only limited military assistance to South Korea after troops withdrew in 1949 because the United States __________.

choices.content: feared that South Korean president Syngman Rhee would try to unify the Korean peninsula through war
wanted to focus on sending troops to the Soviet Union to overthrow Stalin
was concerned that by leaving a large number of troops in South Korea, it would set a precedent for other nations wanting American troops
wanted to preserve the independence of North Korea

answer_3.response: Consider This: Korea had been divided at the 38th parallel in 1945. The Russians installed a communist government under Kim II-Sung in the industrial north. In the agrarian south, Syngman Rhee, a conservative nationalist, became the American-sponsored ruler. Neither regime heeded a UN call for elections to unify the country. See L.O. 28.3 The Cold War Expands.
